meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your boy here, ready to dish out some fun and games. I'm reviewing Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2, the remastered edition that has everyone talking. And let me tell you, it's a real treat.

But before we get into all the gushy praise, let's start with what's on the surface: nostalgia. This game is like a warm hug from your childhood. The levels, the music, the skating - it's all so familiar and comforting. It's like revisiting an old friend who hasn't changed a bit (except for some fancy new graphics and sound design, of course).

Now, let's get to the critics. IGN, GameSpot, Game Informer, Gaming Age, Worth Playing, Cheat Code Central, and SpazioGames - all big names in the gaming world. And what do they have to say? Well, it seems like most of them are singing the same tune: this game is a love letter to the original Tony Hawk games, with some modern tweaks to make it feel fresh and exciting.

GameSpot says it's "really hard to be mad at Pro Skater 1 + 2 for any of its downsides." Yeah, I agree. When you're having so much fun, it's easy to overlook a few minor quibbles (like those pesky load times). Game Informer calls it a "terrific blast from the past" - and that's exactly what it is. And don't even get me started on Gaming Age's glowing review: they practically canonize this game as one of the best remasters out there.

But you know who's not singing along? The hippos, of course! I mean, I'm just joking (or am I?). All kidding aside, it seems like everyone loves Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. And I have to admit, I do too. It's a game that knows what it is and isn't afraid to show its age. But at the same time, it's also got some great modern touches to keep things fresh.

So, there you have it - my Hippo Penny review of Tony Hawk's Pro Skater 1 + 2. If you're looking for a game that'll take you on a trip down memory lane while still delivering plenty of thrills and spills, this is the one. Trust me, you won't be disappointed.
